direction.raw_text: of HEAVY RIVETED IRON DOORS with round handles covered by spider webs. Two "GIANTS", wearing leopard-skin shorts, iron bicep-bands and headbands, pull the heavy iron doors open revealing the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of the MAUSOLEUM.  There is an ornate stone sarcophagus in the center of the room, raised up on an altar.  The back wall has a mantle with a bust of the Virgin Mary looking downward at the coffin.  There is a round red window in the center of the wall.  A ray of red light shines through the window, illuminating the misty fog hanging in the air. The giants walk into the Mausoleum.  They lift the heavy stone lid off of the coffin, revealing CRISWELL.  He is lying in the coffin on his back, with his arms crossed over his chest and eyes closed.  He is wearing black suit pants, a white shirt, a black ribbon-like bow-tie, and a black satin cape.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: SOLE RULER OF THE DARK WORLD,

direction.raw_text: We see CRISWELL, Narrator of our tale and SOLE RULER OF THE DARK WORLD, now sitting upright, slouching somewhat in his coffin, glancing offscreen (at his cue card). During his monologue, each time Criswell looks up at the camera a DRAMATIC PAUSE is inserted as he then looks back down at the cue card and searches for his place in order to continue.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I am Criswell!  For years I have told the almost unbelievable, related the unreal, and shown it to be more ...than a fact. Now I tell a tale of the threshold, people, so astounding that some of you may faint.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of an ancient TOMBSTONE, surrounded by fog, with a human SKULL sitting at its base.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of BLACK RAVEN with thick fog swirling around it
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Another tombstone, with a cherub-like engraving on the front DISSOLVE TO: A plaque-like grave stone on the ground with fog swirling over it, a Skull and a long bone sitting on the ground by it
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: are superimposed over a still photo of a Gilded Nude Female Figure sitting on the stone altar in the MAUSOLEUM.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (Voice Over) This is a story of those in the twilight time...once human, now monsters, in a void between the living and the dead. Monsters to be pitied, monsters to be despised...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) A night with the Ghouls...the ghouls reborn, from the innnermost depths...of the world.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: TITLE MUSIC BEGINS MAIN TITLES TITLES

direction.raw_text: presents CRISWELL in
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Copyright by Astra Productions 1965 starring
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Black Ghoul
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gold Girl Dance...........PAT BARRINGER Hawaiian Dance.............MICKEY JINES Skeleton Dance...........BARBARA NORDIN Indian Dance...............BUNNY GLASER Slave Dance..............NADEJDA DOBREV Street Walker Dance......COLEEN O'BRIEN Cat Dance...................TEXAS STARR Fluff Dance................RENE DE BEAU Mexican Dance...........STEPHANIE JONES Zombie Dance...............DENE STARNES Mummy.......................LOUIS OJENA Wolf Man...................JOHN ANDREWS Doctor...................EDWARD TONTINI Second Doctor............WILLIAM BONNER Giants....................ROD LINDEMANN Detective...................JOHN BEALEY Nurse....................ARLENE SPOONER Costumes.................ROBERT DARIEUX Art Director.............ROBERT LATHROP Sets..................ERNEST BOUVENKAMP Sound.......................DALE KNIGHT Assistant Cameraman......ROBERT MAXWELL Make-up.................MARGARET DAVIES Hairdresser..............NANCY SANDOVAL Choreographer..................MARC DESMOND Still Photographer............ROBERT WILSON Production Supervisor..........TAD STAFFORD Post Production Supervisor..DONALD A. DAVIS Color.........................EASTMAN COLOR Processing.....CONSOLIDATED FILM INDUSTRIES Screenplay by
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: as Shirley
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: as Bob featuring
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . WOOD, JR. From his novel "Orgy of the Dead" Director of Cinematography
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Associate Producers
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .S. JENSEN NEIL B. STEIN Produced and Directed by A. C. STEPHEN FADE TO BLACK. FADE IN. EXT. HIGHWAY IN WILDERNESS.  "NIGHT" A CONVERTIBLE is driving along a DESERT ROAD.  LONG SHOTS of the automobile driving are filmed in bright sunlight.  The desert hills are clearly visible in the background, with only a slight darkening to suggest day-for-night, but the car's headlights are on so we clearly understand that it is pitch black in the dead of night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  NIGHT BOB and SHIRLEY are seated in the CONVERTIBLE, driving through the night, on a "date".  They are searching for an ancient
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  MEDIUM SHOTS have a pitch black background and dark shadows across the car. Shirley is leaning over in her seat toward Bob, who is driving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob lets go of the wheel with his right arm and puts it around Shirley, who leans closer against him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shirley looks up at Bob and smiles.  He tilts his head down and they kiss.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We sure picked the wrong night to find a cemetery.  Let's turn back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.  It's on a night like this when the best ideas come to mind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But does it have to be in a cemetery?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You wouldn't understand.  Seeing a cemetery on a night like this can stir in the mind the best ideas for a good horror story.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But there're so many wonderful things to write about, Bob.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure there are--and I've tried them all.  Plays, love stories, westerns, dog stories.  Huh, now there was a good one, that dog story all about--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (interrupting) But horror stories!  Why all the time horror stories?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shirley, I wrote for years without selling a single word.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My monsters have done well for me.  You think I'd give that up just so I could write about trees, or dogs, or daisies? Huhuh--Daisies!  That's it, I'll write about my creatures who are pushing up the daisies.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your puritan upbringing holds you back from my monsters, but it certainly doesn't hurt your art of kissing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's life.  My kisses are alive.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who's to say my monsters aren't alive?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: of the car driving down the road
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: back to MEDIUM SHOT of Bob and Shirley
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: All of my books are based on fact, or legend.  Thats perhaps why they're more interesting and sell in the top spots.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, fact or not, I don't see how we're going to find an ancient cemetery in these mountains tonight.  I can't see a thing!  Let's turn back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's an old cemetery on this road. I've been there before.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of car driving up a desert road with a sandy mountain in the background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob takes his arm from around Shirley and puts it back on the wheel.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm getting the jitters! Let's turn back!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reluctantly) Okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just as soon as I find a place wide enough to turn around.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of CAR INTERIOR - DASHBOARD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Bob and Shirley
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We hear sounds of tires squealing on the road.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Not so fast!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of car wheel racing along the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Bob and Shirley
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (desperately) Not so fast!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  Bob steps hard on the brake, then pumps the brake repeatedly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Bob and Shirley.  Shirley screams and hides her face with her hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: IN on a high dirt bank at the roadside, then the screen swirls and spins quickly to suggest a dizzying automobile crash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. WOODS - NIGHT Bob and Shirley are lying on their backs, unconcsious, on the ground.  The ground is covered by scattered leaves. Misty fog swirls over them. (beat) Shirley wakes up and sits upright groggily.  She looks around, then looks down at Bob.  She moves toward him and cradles his head in her lap. DISSOLVE TO: EXT. CEMETERY - NIGHT Cemetery is filled with fog.  We see a large stone throne framed by ornate columns, with an altar beneath it.  There are tombstones in the background, and skulls and bones on the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S RIGHT across a small clearing to the MAUSOLEUM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the cold light of the moon, howl the dog and the wolf, and creeping things crawl out of the slime.  It is then the ghouls feast in all their radiance. The Mausoleum doors creak open on their own, and Criswell quickly stalks out across the clearing, hiding his face behind his long black cape which is held up with his bent elbow against his face, in Dracula fashion.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It is said on clear nights, beneath
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (VO - Continuing) It is on nights like this most people prefer to steer clear of, uh, Burial Grounds . It is on nights like this, that the creatures are said to appear, and to walk !
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: , CRISWELL CLIMBING ONTO HIS THRONE Criswell walks up the steps to the altar, across the altar, and then sits down on the stone seat.  He then slowly lowers his cape from his face and regally looks off to the right (at his cue card).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Criswell repeatedly beckons slowly toward himself with his right hand, staring across the clearing at the mausoleum. The PRINCESS OF DARKNESS is standing in front of the Mausoleum.  She walks into the clearing with an entrancing demeanor, her arms outstretched straight in front of her. She is wearing a long black low-cut dress with long open sleeves.  The sleeves are lined with red and hang down a couple feet from her wrists.  She walks slowly over toward Criswell's throne. The Princess of Darkness stands beside Criswells throne, crosses her forearms in front of her chest, and bows toward him.  He nods toward her.  She reaches out and places her left hand on Criswell's right hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Criswell continues to hold the Princess of Darkness's hand, and she looks at him seductively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Princess of Darkness again crosses her arms in front of her chest and slowly bows to Criswell.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The day is gone, the night is upon us, and the moon, which controls all of the underworld, once again shines...in radiant contentment. (beat) Come forth, come forth, o Princess of Darkness.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Time seems to stand still.  Not so the ghouls, when a night of Pleasure is at hand!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If I am not pleased by tonight's entertainment, I shall banish their souls to everlasting damnation!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: shot of the FULL MOON with dramatic cymbals crashing, then back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Princess of Darkness claps twice, summoning the first of the night's entertainers.  These poor souls must dance for Criswell's approval.  If he is pleased, they can continue to entertain him for centuries, but if not, they will be banished to everlasting damnation by the All-powerful Criswell.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: And who is to be first?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  Huge flames rise from the ground in front of the clearing.  The INDIAN GIRL enters the clearing and begins to Dance.  She is wearing a red Native American- style dress and headband.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The INDIAN GIRL DANCE begins. The Indian Girl dances around for awhile, then dances away into the foggy background. EXT. WOODS - NIGHT Bob slowly wakes up and sits up.  Bob and Shirley look around. EXT. GRAVEYARD - NIGHT The Princess of Darkness points dramatically toward the mausoleum and begins to speak without moving her lips!  A marvel of filmmaking art.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The STREET WALKER DANCE begins.  The STREET WALKER walks into the clearing wearing a pink dress and purple feather boa, and beckons with her finger as if to say, "Come here, Criswell!" EXT. WOODS.  NIGHT. At the car accident scene with Bob and Shirley, slow jazz music is audible from the nearby festivities in the cemetery. Bob and Shirley are still sitting on the ground, looking toward the source of the music.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: One who loved flames.  Her lover was killed by flames.  She died in flames.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (out of sync with picture) One who prowls the lonely streets at night in life is bound to prowl them in eternity.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ahh, the curiousity of youth... on the road to ruin!  May it ever be so adventurous!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm so frightened.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well we certainly can't stay here. C'mon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob helps Shirley up from the ground and leads her into the thick bushes. EXT. CEMETERY, NIGHT Criswell nods repeatedly, smiling at the dancer in approval. The Street Walker's clothes have suddenly disappeared. Bob and Shirley creep beneath the bushes, crouched down low. They reach the edge of the clearing where Criswell and the Princess of Darkness are watching the Street Walker Dance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Street Walker dances with a Skeleton that is hanging by the door of the mausoleum. The Street Walker dance ends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Princess of Darkness points dramatically toward the mausoleum again to start off the next dance. The giants walk to the doors, now wearing red and white horizontal-striped miniskirts (or ancient egyptian garb?). They pull the iron doors open slowly, and we see the GOLD GIRL DANCER lying on her back on the altar inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Gold Girl Dancer rises slowly and seductively from the table, then stalkingly dances out into the clearing.  She is wearing a metallic gold tunic-like dress. We see a shot of Bob and Shirley watching, and suddenly the Gold Girl's dress has disappeared. The Gold Girl Dance continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The giants pick up a bucket of gold doubloons and begin slowly sprinkling them over the Gold Girl as she dances. She sits on the ground and reaches for the falling coins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The giants continue dropping gold coins on the Gold Girl. She picks up the gold coins, rubbing them over her body, in ecstasy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The giants continue, to the delight of Criswell.  The Gold girl tries to scoop all the scattered coins closer to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The giants continue.  Criswell is thrilled, and begins to LAUGH loudly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Princess of Darkness laughs in acknowledgement, then claps her hands twice, commanding the Giants to finish the ceremony. The Giants walk toward the Gold Girl, who is still on the ground playing with the gold coins and rubbing them on her body.  The giants pick up the Gold Girl, who resists, trying to maintain contact with the gold.  She reaches for it as they lift her up.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: In there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It frightens me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Silly, there's nothing in there to be afraid of.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then..then what's that music?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's what I want to find out. We have to get help.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What help can we possibly find in the cemetery at this time of night?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Something's making that music.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not sure I care to find out what it is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right.  Don't worry, I'll be right beside you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What help will that do if something in there isn't dead?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not dead?  In a cemetery?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't imagine anything dead playing that music.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, it's probably just the caretaker, and that's exactly who we want to find.  They'll have a telephone.  C'mon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Could it be some kind of college initiation?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's an initiation all right, but not of a college as you and I know them.  Nothing alive looks like that!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can't we get out of here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not sure...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you mean?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not sure, myself. It's just a feeling I've had since the crash...Like I feel a cold chill all over.. ..Now this!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I would see for approval, the one who in life worshipped gold above all else.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pointing toward the mausoleum) Look!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Be careful!--They'll see you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Throw gold at her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: More gold.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (excitedly) More gold!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (impatiently) More gold!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to the Princess) For all eternity, she shall have gold.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of a BUBBLING GIANT CAULDRON full of a substance that is supposed to look like gold. The Giants dip the Gold Girl feet first into the cauldron, submerging her entire body. A few seconds later, the giants lift the Gold Girl out of the cauldron.  Her body is now entirely gilded, and she is stiff. They lift her onto their shoulders, carrying her like a board, walking in front of Criswell's throne, then back into the mausoleum, laying her body on the altar. We see Bob and Shirley, looking dismayed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deep in the woods, we see THE WOLF MAN and THE MUMMY, walking quickly. Suddenly, Bob and Shirley are grabbed from behind by the WOLF MAN and the MUMMY.  The Wolf Man and The Mummy drag Bob and Shirley over to the clearing near Criswell's throne. The Princess of Darkness is now seated at Criswell's right side with him on his throne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Princess of Darkness stands and walks to the end of the altar below Criswell's throne, then sits on the lower seat at the end of the altar and crosses her legs. The Wolf Man and The Mummy drag Bob and Shirley over to the center of the clearing to face Criswell, The Sole Ruler of the Dark World.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mummy motions toward the Wolf Man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Medium Shot of Princess of Darkness.  (Suddenly the Princess of  Darkness is beside the throne again, several feet from the seat at the foot of the altar)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: And both couldn't help but remember a line from one of Bob's stories:  "A sudden wind howls.  The night things are all about me.  Every shadow, a beckoning invitation...to disaster.  I know I should think of other things, of pleasant things, but I can't. How can I think of other things, of pleasant things, when I am in a place surrounded by shadows and objects, which can take any shape, here in the darkness...Any shape my mind can conceive."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bring 'em in!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They are live ones?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with audible tape hiss added) Yes, Master.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Live ones where only the dead should be?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, Master, and we caught them, him and me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You shall both be rewarded. (To Princess) My Dear Empress of the Night, put these intruders to the test.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But they are not yet one of us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (happily) A situation easily remedied.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tie them that they may watch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: back to long shot of the entire throne and throne altar. The Princess of        Darkness is now seated again at the end of the altar. The Wolf Man and The Mummy tie Bob and Shirley to very tall grave stones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to medium-close shot of Princess of Darkness, whose chest is heaving excitedly as she grips the handle of the long sacrificial dagger tucked into the belt at her waist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Criswell motions toward The Princess of Darkness, who then walks back up onto the altar and then sits down beside Criswell again. The CAT GIRL DANCE begins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Cat Girl Dance ends.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (desperately, to Criswell) Fiend!  Fiend!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To love the cat, is to be the cat!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (jovially) A pussycat is born to be whipped.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (excitedly) It will please me very much to see the Slave Girl with her tortures!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: interior of the stone mausoleum.  The Ancient Egyptian SLAVE GIRL is chained from her wrists to a high hook on the wall.  One of the "giants" pretends to whip her with a cat o' nine tails.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: back to CRISWELL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The slave girl pulls with all her might and the chains suddenly pop off the hook.  She then pushes the iron doors open and dances out into the clearing. The Slave Dance concludes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shirley closes her eyes and sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Camera zooms back and we see that the Wolf Man and The Mummy are hiding behind Bob and Shirley.  The Wolf Man has his hand up to his ear so he can hear what Bob and Shirley are saying. The Wolf Man and The Mummy then creep over toward Criswell's throne. The Wolf Man whispers into The Princess of Darkness's ear while The Mummy and Criswell watch. The Princess of Darkness gets up from the throne and walks over to Shirley.  Shirley grimaces.  The Princess of Darkness unbuttons Shirley's blouse, then marks Shirley's abdomen with a red (blood?) cross using her long sharp fingernail. Shirley screams. The Princess of Darkness pulls her long dagger out of her belt and raises it, staring into Shirley's eyes.  Suddenly, Criswell yells:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Princess of Darkness pauses and looks back at Criswell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Princess of Darkness reluctantly puts her dagger back in her belt and tucks Shirley's blouse back in. The Princess of Darkness walks back to Criswell's throne. He pulls a human skull out from behind his seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Princess of Darkness takes the skull from Criswell and throws it dramatically into the clearing. The MEXICAN DANCE (SKULL DANCE) ensues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Princess of Darkness snaps her fingers, starting the HAWAIIAN DANCE (SNAKE DANCE).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A couple times during the dance, there are abrupt cuts to STOCK FOOTAGE of a rattlesnake in a bright daylight shot in tall dry grass.  (Looks like it was from a documentary)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hawaiian Dance continues, then cut to The Mummy and The Wolf Man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hawaiian/Snake Girl continues to dance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Hawaiian Dance ends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (continuing, after finding his place on the next cue card) Now, I will talk...to The Wolf Man...and The Mummy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Princess of Darkness motions for The Wolf Man and The Mummy to come.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wants us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Wolf Man and The Mummy walk over to Criswell's Throne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Wolf Man bows to Criswell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Wolf Man and the Mummy crouch in fear as they face Criswell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mummy Sighs in relief and the Wolf Man nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Princess of Darkness points up at the full moon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Princess of Darkness gets up from the seat at the end of the altar and walks around beside Criswell's throne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob's hands are wiggling, trying to loosen the rope binding his wrists behind his back around the stone column.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Princess of Darkness is leaning over, covering her mouth and whispering into Criswell's ear, looking over her hand back at Shirley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Princess of Darkness crosses her forearms and bows to Criswell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The SKELETON DANCE begins. The SKELETON DANCE GIRL, wearing a white dress and long wedding veil, comes into the clearing with a skeleton.  She dances with the skeleton, then dances in the clearing for Criswell. The Skeleton Dance concludes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shirley is silent and looks downward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Wolf Man leans back and howls.  (He tilts his head back so far his fake rubber wolfman mask comes up and you can see his skin at the bottom of his neck)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob looks down somberly, then looks over at Shirley.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (excitedly) Torture! Torture!  It pleasures me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm so frightened.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You've got a right to be. We're trapped by a bunch of fiends.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Those creatures..!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't let them hear you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What can we do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know.  I just don't know. But don't give up. We're not finished yet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Easy Shirley, Easy!  Panic won't do us any good!  Let me think. We've got to stall for time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm afraid I'll faint.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whatever you do, don't do that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let her continue to learn. The time is not yet right that they should join with us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...And what is this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A symbol, Master.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What kind of symbol?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She loved the bull ring and the matador.  She danced to their destruction. Now she dances to her own destruction.  Her dance is of skulls.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She came to us on the Day of the Dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: El Dia De Los Muertos...A celebration in her country.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Her dance has pleased me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: With the loss of her lover, this one cast herself into the Volcano's fire.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She was?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As I said, a worshipper of snakes, and of smoke, and flames.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, yes, a religion of sorts.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It would seem so, Master.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't like snakes.  I remember the one Cleopatra used.  Cute little rascal until it flicked out that red tongue, and those two sharp fangs.  You'd never think such a little thing packed such a big wallop.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aaaaahhnnnhaaaaaannnhhh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hurt her?  Hell, it killed her!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in agreement) Aaaahhhhnnnahhhnnnggnnn.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We had lots of snakes in my ancient Egypt...slimy, slinky things.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aahhhhnnnaaahahnn. AaaaaahhhhoooWWWOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When I was alive, they were the things nightmares were made of.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aaarrrgggaahh.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She pleases me.  Permit her to live in the World of the Snakes. (audible cue card flip)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As you wish, Master
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aaahhnnnahnnnn.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you suppose for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aaaaannnnnuuunnnuhhhhh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you do something to get us into trouble again?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aannnnaahhnn.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you howl off-key at the moon again?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aannnnaahhnn.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't remember doing anything wrong either.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We better go before we make him mad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (apprehensively) We are your servants, Master.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course you are.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have we in some way made you angry, Master?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know better than that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We don't know of anything, Master...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then why do you shake so?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not often an Emperor like you calls on creatures like us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well rest easy, I'm not angry with either of you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (relieved) Aaaahhhh.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then it is some service you desire of us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You are the keepers of the Damned.  You two know them all. And I am tired of this usual type of entertainment. I want...a decided change.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The moon! ...is soon gone!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There is little time left for the remainder of the evening's pleasures.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, yes yes I know all that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At the first sight of the morning sun's rays, we must be gone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I suppose most of the others will have to wait for their judgement until after the next full moon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It would seem so, Master
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ahh, but I declare there is still time for some thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There are one or two which should complement the night's entertainment, Master
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ahh, good.  Then I will see them.  Dismiss the rest.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, sir, Master.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The ropes are coming loose.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Be careful!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am--It's our only chance.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing is worth your life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My guess is if we don't take the chance pretty soon, we're not going to have much life left anyway.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm frightened.  I'm so frightened.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hold on just a little longer, Shirley.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Be careful, oh please be careful.  We'll never get out of here alive, I know it.  I just feel it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes I feel it in my bones.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're talking nonsense.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, no I'm not.  These heathens probably have an open grave for us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They wouldn't dare put us in the same grave-- or would they?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I should hope not.  I hate you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That sudden?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, that sudden.  If it weren't for you we wouldn't be hunting for an old cemetery on a night like this.  It's all your fault.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (dejected) ...And I thought you loved me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not yet.  I perhaps have other plans for such a pretty one. No matter, I will tell you when and if you may have her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Wolf Man informs me that the next one is the woman who murdered her husband on their wedding night.  Now she dances with his skeleton.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Shirley) Have you not enjoyed the evening's festivities?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ahh, that will soon change when you become one of us!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: AAAAAAAAAHHGGGGGHHHHHHHhhhhhh!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It would seem that The Wolf Man would have you for his own!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have promised both The Wolf Man and The Mummy a reward.  It could be that you are that reward.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You need not worry...Not just now, anyway.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Leave her alone, you fiend!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fiend is it!  You will not be so fortunate.  Your existence will cease within moments.  No one wishes to see a man dance... (looking at Shirley) And you, my dear, will entertain for centuries to come.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If I could get my hands on you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ..Oh, You could do nothing! (to Shirley) I can save you much pain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Leave her alone, I tell you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Shirley) I do not joke in my proposal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She is to be mine! It is so spoken!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Princess of Darkness would have you for her own to join us through extreme pain. (beat) Yet I am inclined for one as lovely as you, to be more lenient. I have but to touch you with my finger, and it would mean the end of you, all over, quickly and painlessly...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. No! No!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I repulse you?  Very well.  It seems you have chosen your own fate. Live with it!  I should say die with it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've got the ropes loose now. I've got my hands free.  Be careful--Don't change your expression too much.  They must not catch on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What can we do against them?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know, yet.  We'll just have to watch our chance. When it comes I'll know what to do--I hope I'll know what to do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I still don't know what ever made me go steady with a crackpot writer like you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right.  Put it on heavy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My old boyfriend Tommy would never have gotten me in a mess like this.  At least he's got brains.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Him! I'll bet he sleeps with all the lights on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: shot of The Mummy talking to The Wolf Man
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I could make her another Cleopatra...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ahh hahahhnnn hahnnn!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Without the snake, of course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (impatiently) Well?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Princess of Darkness snaps her fingers three times, summoning the Zombie Dance Girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ZOMBIE DANCE GIRL dances.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Zombie Dance concludes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The FLUFF DANCE Girl dances for approval. The Fluff Dance ends. Criswell looks over at the Princess of Darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Princess of Darkness begins ceremoniously dancing with her long sacrificial dagger, slowly moving toward shirley, gazing back at Criswell seductively.  She finally gets to Shirley and cuts the button off of Shirley's shirt, which was so tight it was about to burst open anyway.  She unsnaps the front of Shirley's bra. Bob sees his chance and makes his attempt at a "move," merely stepping forward.  He is instantly hammer-fisted on the back of the neck by The Wolf Man, and falls down unconscious. The Princess of Darkness raises her long dagger high above Shirley's head.  But suddenly, the sun rises (it is already high overhead), and the night creatures lose their power.  The Princess of Darkness clings to Shirley's arm, as she slowly sinks down to the ground, losing all strength. The Camera pans around, showing Shirley and Bob's faces, then back to the ghouls, all of whom have turned to steaming skeletons.  Only their clothing and bones remain. Quick Zoom in on Criswell's throne.  Criswell's steaming skeleton still sits, surveying the cemetery, wearing his cape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. WOODS - MORNING At the clearing in the woods near the car wreck, Bob and Shirley are lying on their backs on the ground, just as they were after the crash, before they got up to investigate the strange music that led them to the ghouls. There are two DOCTORS examining Bob and Shirley. In the foreground, we see a REPORTER's shoulder and hands. He is writing down details of the accident in a small paper pad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The reporter walks around and crouches beside Shirley and DOCTOR #1, and continues writing in his pad. A Newspaper PHOTOGRAPHER crouches in the foreground to get a shot of the accident scene and victims.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shirley points to her abdomen where The Princess of Darkness had made the X with her fingernail.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ahh, she will be yours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (impatiently) When!?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At your discretion...But first, I desire more entertainment.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The moon is almost gone!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ahh, there is yet time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At the first sight of the morning's rays' light...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (getting annoyed) I know the laws of the night. I state there is still time for yet another.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (forcefully) I would have time for my own pleasures!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (angrily) Your own pleasure comes only after mine, when I desire it. I am the Sole Ruler of the Dark World.  There is no one to challenge my authority here. My word is the law--all powerful. No one is to challenge that authority, no one! .  Is that understood?  It is my command.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I understand, Master
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then see that it does not happen again, in the penalty of Everlasting Despair.  Now are there others?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There are others.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well then let us proceed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She lived as a zombie in life, so she will remain forever a zombie in death.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Easy, Shirley.  Easy!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The moon sinks lower into the hills!  We must hurry to the finish.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I will decide the conclusion.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (impatiently) You had the mummy cancel all the others scheduled for this session.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (interrupting) Then cancel my order.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The moon is almost gone!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There is yet time.  Don't you want your own pleasure?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, if there is only time!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hahh, there is always time... All in good time...there is always time.  You shall have your pleasure. THAT ... I decree
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking at Shirley) All others were but infinitessimal bits of fluff, compared to her (toward the Dancer) This one would have died for feathers, furs, and fluff...and so she did!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The time...is short.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For what!?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your pleasures of course!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You mean...!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You may take her now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is there time?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You better hope there is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you, Master!  Thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now hurry, hurry.  I will watch!  Your desires may be my pleasure also...Our fitting climax to an evening's enter- tainment.  You must...hurry now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: #1 Easy, Miss, everything's gonna be alright.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bob?  Bob?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: #1 He's right here beside you. He'll be alright too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where are they, where did they go? They tried to kill me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: #2 What's this you say?  Who was going to kill you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The ghouls--they all turned into skeletons.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: #2 Take it easy, Miss.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: #1 What she needs is a good rest.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's true, I tell you, it's true!  They all turned into skeletons.  She-she cut me here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: crouches down and pulls out a length of medical tape, then hands it to the doctor.  She cuts another piece of tape, but the Doctors don't realize this and leave her hanging...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The doctors put Shirley onto a stretcher while the photographer takes more pictures.  They put her into the back of an ambulance. Then after the doctor listens to Bob's neck with a stethoscope, Bob just gets up and walks into the back of the ambulance.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: #1 Probably was bruised in the crash.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: #2 You know, you two were very lucky.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I love you Bob. I really do. Forgive me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's nothing to forgive. It was all a dream.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You love me then?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course I do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As it is with all the Night People, they are destroyed by the first rays of the sun. But upon the first appearance of the deep shadows of the night, and when the moon is full, they will return, to rejoice...in their evil lust, and take back with them any mortal who might happen along.
dialogue.name: dialogue
